verbLexeme: 1. To completely change your attitude or opinion about something.
2. To be confused, (be) surprised, (be) thrown off balance or be disoriented, especially by a complete and unexpected change in circumstances.
nominalLexeme: 1. A complete change in attitude or opinion. English = about-turn, about-face.
2. A complete change in circumstances. English = turn-around.
oldEntry: Popular explanation: two faces changing places.
